p:
As a G protein-coupled receptor: G protein-coupled receptor(s) typically binds to a ligand(S) to induce a G protein complex trimer, eventually dissociating into the G
α and G
βγ dimer subunits. These subunits are used to activate the intracellular downstream signaling pathways. G protein-mediated AβPP activation is not very well understood owing to the complexities involved in understanding the G protein coupling and pathways linked to it. Notwithstanding, its involvement in synaptic and in neural activity is very well established [ 27].
